decomposed.wish:
enable secure user authentication and session management.

this capability provides the identity foundation for the platform - validating credentials against identity providers, managing session tokens with configurable expiry, and protecting against brute-force attacks through account lockout policies.

out of scope: authorization (what authenticated users can do), multi-tenant context (handled separately).

enable reliable data persistence with cache invalidation and event emission.

this capability provides the storage foundation - writing to primary datastores, maintaining cache coherence across replicas, and emitting domain events for downstream subscribers.

out of scope: what entities are persisted (domain-specific), event consumption (handled by subscribers).

enable real-time notification delivery via websockets.

this capability pushes events to subscribed clients in real-time, tracks delivery status, handles retries on failure, and queues notifications for disconnected clients until reconnection.

out of scope: what events trigger notifications (domain-specific), notification content formatting.

enable analytics visualization and custom report generation for authenticated admins.

this capability aggregates data from event stores, applies configurable filters, renders visualizations, and supports custom report templates with caching for repeated access.

out of scope: data ingestion (handled by persistence layer), admin role definition (handled by auth).

enable multi-tenant architecture with strict isolation boundaries.

this capability enforces tenant boundaries on all requests, applies tenant-specific configuration, maintains tenant context in logging, and prevents cross-tenant data access with security event logging.

out of scope: tenant provisioning/onboarding, tenant-specific feature flags.

enable api rate limiting and quota management per client.

this capability tracks request rates per client, returns 429 responses with retry-after headers when limits are exceeded, manages quota consumption, and notifies on threshold breaches.

out of scope: pricing/billing integration, quota allocation policies.
